page.title: 11Changes at Eckington School.
page.content: We examined the school log between the years 1935-1985. Between the years 1935-1940 we noticed that they had days off for Royal occasions . In the early Forties, children were fitted with gas masks because of the outbreak of war. Evacuees were brought from Birmingham and were taught with local children. The Wings for Victory week raised Â£200 to buy parts for aeroplanes. In 1945 there were V.E. day celebrations. Between 1950 and 1959, students came from Worcester College. Children began to go on school trips. There were open days for parents. In the Sixties, swimming lessons started at Tewkwsbury pool, cycling proficiency tests were given and school sports were held every year. In the Seventies there were 143 on the school roll. In the Eighties the school got its first computer.
